trans-unit.source: Application Insights for Android apps | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Application Insights for Android apps | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Analyze usage and performance of your Android app with Application Insights.
trans-unit.target: Analyze usage and performance of your Android app with Application Insights.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio Application Insights lets you monitor your mobile application for usage, events, and crashes.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio Application Insights lets you monitor your mobile application for usage, events, and crashes.

trans-unit.source: You'll need:
trans-unit.target: You'll need:

trans-unit.source: A subscription with <linkText>Microsoft Azure</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: A subscription with <linkText>Microsoft Azure</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You sign in with a Microsoft account, which you might have for Windows, XBox Live, or other Microsoft cloud services.
trans-unit.target: You sign in with a Microsoft account, which you might have for Windows, XBox Live, or other Microsoft cloud services.

trans-unit.source: Android Studio
trans-unit.target: Android Studio

trans-unit.source: Android SDK Version 9 or later.
trans-unit.target: Android SDK Version 9 or later.

trans-unit.source: In the <linkText>Azure portal[portal]</linkText><title></title>, create a new Application Insights resource.
trans-unit.target: In the <linkText>Azure portal[portal]</linkText><title></title>, create a new Application Insights resource.

trans-unit.source: Pick the Android option.
trans-unit.target: Pick the Android option.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Click New, Developer services, Application Insights</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Click New, Developer services, Application Insights</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The blade that opens is the place where you'll see performance and usage data about your app.
trans-unit.target: The blade that opens is the place where you'll see performance and usage data about your app.

trans-unit.source: To get back to it next time you login to Azure, you should find a tile for it on the start screen.
trans-unit.target: To get back to it next time you login to Azure, you should find a tile for it on the start screen.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively click Browse to find it.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively click Browse to find it.

trans-unit.source: (If you didn't do this already.)
trans-unit.target: (If you didn't do this already.)

trans-unit.source: Start Android Studio and configure plugins.
trans-unit.target: Start Android Studio and configure plugins.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Choose Configure</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Choose Configure</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select and install the Application Insights Android Studio plugin.
trans-unit.target: Select and install the Application Insights Android Studio plugin.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select the plugin</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select the plugin</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Tool > Integrate Application Insights SDK.
trans-unit.target: Select Tool > Integrate Application Insights SDK.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Integrate Application Insights</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Integrate Application Insights</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Create a component in your subscription
trans-unit.target: Create a component in your subscription

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create a component</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create a component</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Use the instrumentation key you got from your Application Insights resource.
trans-unit.target: Use the instrumentation key you got from your Application Insights resource.

trans-unit.source: Sync gradle to download the SDK and integrate with your project
trans-unit.target: Sync gradle to download the SDK and integrate with your project

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Sync gradle files to download the SDK</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Sync gradle files to download the SDK</linkText>

trans-unit.source: (Additional information is available from the <linkText>usage page</linkText><title></title>.)
trans-unit.target: (Additional information is available from the <linkText>usage page</linkText><title></title>.)

trans-unit.source: At this point, the following reference was added to the modules build.gradle, permissions for INTERNET and ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE, and a metadata tag containing the component's instrumentation key were added to the modules's AndroidManifest.xml
trans-unit.target: At this point, the following reference was added to the modules build.gradle, permissions for INTERNET and ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE, and a metadata tag containing the component's instrumentation key were added to the modules's AndroidManifest.xml

trans-unit.source: It is also possible to set the instrumentation key in code.
trans-unit.target: It is also possible to set the instrumentation key in code.

trans-unit.source: This will override the one set in AndroidManifest.xml
trans-unit.target: This will override the one set in AndroidManifest.xml

trans-unit.source: Initialize the SDK and start tracking telemetry.
trans-unit.target: Initialize the SDK and start tracking telemetry.

trans-unit.source: Add the following import to your app's root activity:
trans-unit.target: Add the following import to your app's root activity:

trans-unit.source: And add the following to the activity's onCreate callback:
trans-unit.target: And add the following to the activity's onCreate callback:

trans-unit.source: Once ApplicationInsights.start() is called, the SDK begins tracking android lifecycle activity and any unhandled exceptions.
trans-unit.target: Once ApplicationInsights.start() is called, the SDK begins tracking android lifecycle activity and any unhandled exceptions.

trans-unit.source: Application lifecycle events are only collected in Android SDK version 15 and later (Ice Cream Sandwich+).
trans-unit.target: Application lifecycle events are only collected in Android SDK version 15 and later (Ice Cream Sandwich+).

trans-unit.source: In addition to this, custom events, traces, metrics, and handled exceptions can be collected.
trans-unit.target: In addition to this, custom events, traces, metrics, and handled exceptions can be collected.

trans-unit.source: Use any of the <linkText>Application Insights API[api]</linkText><title></title> to send telemetry.
trans-unit.target: Use any of the <linkText>Application Insights API[api]</linkText><title></title> to send telemetry.

trans-unit.source: TrackEvent(eventName) for other user actions
trans-unit.target: TrackEvent(eventName) for other user actions

trans-unit.source: TrackTrace(logEvent) for <linkText>diagnostic logging[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: TrackTrace(logEvent) for <linkText>diagnostic logging[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: TrackHandledException(exception) in catch clauses
trans-unit.target: TrackHandledException(exception) in catch clauses

trans-unit.source: TrackMetric(name, value) in a background task to send regular reports of metrics not attached to specific events
trans-unit.target: TrackMetric(name, value) in a background task to send regular reports of metrics not attached to specific events

trans-unit.source: The following code is an example of initialization and manual telemetry collection:
trans-unit.target: The following code is an example of initialization and manual telemetry collection:

trans-unit.source: Run your application (SHIFT+F10 in Windows, CTRL+R in OS X) to generate telemetry.
trans-unit.target: Run your application (SHIFT+F10 in Windows, CTRL+R in OS X) to generate telemetry.

trans-unit.source: Return to http://portal.azure.com and browse to your Application Insights resource.
trans-unit.target: Return to http://portal.azure.com and browse to your Application Insights resource.

trans-unit.source: Click Search to open Diagnostic Search[diagnostic] - that's where the first events will appear.
trans-unit.target: Click Search to open Diagnostic Search[diagnostic] - that's where the first events will appear.

trans-unit.source: If you don't see anything, wait a minute or two and click Refresh.
trans-unit.target: If you don't see anything, wait a minute or two and click Refresh.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Click Diagnostic Search</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Click Diagnostic Search</linkText>

trans-unit.source: As your app is used, data appears in the overview blade.
trans-unit.target: As your app is used, data appears in the overview blade.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Overview blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Overview blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click on any chart to get more detail.
trans-unit.target: Click on any chart to get more detail.

trans-unit.source: For example, crashes:
trans-unit.target: For example, crashes:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Click the crash chart</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Click the crash chart</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Track usage of your app[track]</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Track usage of your app[track]</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Diagnostic search[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Diagnostic search[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Metric Explorer[metrics]</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Metric Explorer[metrics]</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Troubleshooting[qna]</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Troubleshooting[qna]</linkText><title></title>
